pros: Friendly and supportive place to work.
cons: The NHS is hierarchical :(.

pros: Great working environment, supportive colleagues
cons: Low pay, unmanageable workload, high stress level and responsibility for banding

pros: Work colleagues kind & supportive
cons: HR, Payroll management way behind other trust i have worked for.

pros: Good Work life. Pleasant People.
cons: Not much diversity. Bad parking

pros: The HR, CEO, management seem to really care. I've had fabulous Sisters and matrons (mostly). POlicies to help the great HCAs move up bands. Brilliant staff canteen. Star awards, There's a social life if you get involved. There's always initiatives and events you just need to read your emails (which it's hard to find time to). Mental health support is good but you need to ask for it. The medical teams are really great towards us nurses. The international nurses are stars.
cons: Bullying and moaning. A lot of agency staff who don't always pull their weight. HCAs taking huge breaks whilst you run a ward solo. Most of the cons are a direct result of the government's policies not the Trust's - ie understaffing or lack of facilities. Abuse from patients. Being lumped with Scarborough Hospital's problems. People in senior nursing positions that aren't equipped or suited to the role but they're the only applicants for the jobs.

pros: Canteen, staff shop, holidays and discounts.
cons: Nepotism is rife. Change is shunned. Work life balance is nonexistent.

review_title: Not the best place to work
pros: More opportunities for development in recent years (due to government funding), especially for those wanting to become registered nurses
cons:
Always short staffed, poor management and leadership, not done anything meaningful to address staffing and recruitment, bullying and toxic culture very much an issue here.

Parking charges are extortionate x3 times higher than at Hull Royal and No option for prorata contribution for part time staff/not based on pay bands

pros: Rewarding and fulfilling place to work
cons: lowish salary compared with other organisation

job_title: Diabetic Retinal Screener in Harrogate, England
pros: Fair, friendly, supportive worked in the trust for 5 years and have no complaints.
cons: NHS pay bands could be better

review_title: The most regressive, bureaucratic, and disorganised employer I have ever worked for
pros:
Good pension but we're going to be working until we're dead so...
Flexible shifts, stable job
cons:
Where to start... it took 9 months from being accepted for the job to actually starting the job, the recruitment process was a total joke it was so slow and inefficient; recruitment appointments were spaced months apart when I could have done it all in one week. They refused to pay me 50 hours of mandatory training because it was completed more than 3 months ago?? (despite being told before I signed the contract that they would pay me for all mandatory training I completed). What sort of rule is that? I mean it's not as if they need nurses anyway is it. 

Inefficient systems and the computer software often crash and does not save data, so you must repeat the task, reported to IT months ago and still no improvement. Decisions by management concerning employees is about following rules rather than using common sense or just doing the ethically right thing. So disorganised and disjointed it is a total nightmare trying to get anywhere, employees are treated like a disposable workforce.

pros:
Fast paced trust 
Opportunity to grow
cons:
Recruiting team need to do better
Culture of blame and bullying still needs to checked
Staff shortage equals more workload

job_title: Imaging Support Assistant in York, England
pros: It's not hard work, although there are times when it can be very busy.
cons: It's VERY repetitive & therefore boring. Most of the staff are nice enough, but managers are not the nicest, unless you are one of the favoured few. I've never worked in a place where everything is so much trouble to sort for you/obstacles put in the way. Wherever I have previously worked in the NHS, even if the managers haven't been that great, they have always tried to accommodate leave requests, shift swaps etc BUT NOT HERE! There is also much moving of goalposts depending on which way the wind is blowing or whether there's an "R" in the month!

review_title: Poor Staffing, and don’t care about their staff
pros: - Ability to learn extra skills such as cannulation and Venepuncture
cons:
- Poor pay for long hours and taxing work 
- Seniors don’t care about you AT ALL
- A lot of staff don’t care about the patients 
- Bullying from other staff, management does nothing

pros: Friendly community to work for.
cons: Pay could be a bit more.

job_title: Assistant Project Manager in York, England
pros:
Good benefits:
Pension, holiday pay, flexible working, sickpay , generous maternity leave
cons: Huge staff shortages, very low paid

pros:
Friendly staff and colleagues, it's a great environment to work in. 
City is lovely and food scenes are great, always packed with visitors.
cons:
It can be confusing to orientate around the hospital.
Car park space on site is limited, can be frustrating unless you get in the hospital super early in the morning.

pros: Hospital based on value and mission
cons: Difficult to park on a late shift

job_title: Waiting List Coordinator in York, England
pros: Great job for getting a vast knowledge of the NHS
cons: Stressful sometimes, can be difficult coordinating all stakeholders but that is the nature of the NHS

review_title: Quite good and offers opportunities for career advancements
job_title: Pre Registration Nurse in York, England
pros: Good work environment and work life balance
cons: Salary is low and work is tough

review_title: Perhaps poorest nhs hospital to work.
pros: Nice building, good toilet and bin.
cons: Very poor doctor support compared to other nhs hospital, delay in approving timesheets, try not to approve.

pros: very nice place for work
cons: low salary, no bonus, no owertimes paid

pros: The hospital has the most amazing patients who are full of praise and thanks which makes working truly rewarding. With some lovely staff the hospital runs smoothly. The hospital has some parking spaces, a shop and gorgeous food in Ellerby's restaurant.
cons: Doesn't have any shops for personal extras like boots and clothes shops for patients who don't have families. Patients are bored and show signs of depression/ loneliness on my ward and don't have access to a lounge.

pros: Good training opportunities and good management support.
cons: Understaffed, old equipment and the hospital needs refurbishment.

pros: Benifits, staff shop, local discount
cons:
Poor management 
Poor organisation
